Hey Stun - I'm new to bit torrents. Program DL fine, but how do you open nfo file for the serial? Thanks for the torrent!
@winealot: NFO files are plain text, so although your Mac doesn't know it and thus doesn't give you any "open with" options, pretty much any text editor (i.e. TextEdit) can be used to open the file.

Hey guys, I need some help here. Once I've downloaded the torrent all I have is a load of files numbered like h-rtt1102.r21 (the number after the 'r' goes from 00 to 25), an 'nfo' file and an 'sfv' file. 

I've opened the 'nfo' which has the serial number, but no instructions about what to do with the other files. I also have a file called h-rtt1102.rar which, when extracted, creates an empty folder of the same name. Can someone help?

@DarkOpus - Just download "StuffIt Expander" from the Mac App Store, free of charge, and double click the "h-rtt1102.rar" file - It should automatically open in "StuffIt Expander" and create a .dmg file called "h-rtt1102.dmg" in the "Roxio.Toast.Titanium.v11.0.2.MAC.OSX-HOTiSO" folder. Hope this was helpful!

@MT95PB Thanks! That worked a treat! I wonder why Archive Utility was creating an empty folder from the .rar file... doesn't matter now, I've set Stuffit Expander as the default for .rar files. Once more, thanks for your help, much appreciated. :-)
